This must return true. A System which does not have a schedule is allways in maintenance mode. This is the current behavior, you can schedule things at any time.
(The final return false in Line 2205 is correct. When a client has a schedule but no calendar, this client is 'never' in maintenance mode.

Here we need to be careful with the performance. When this one action has 10000 clients this gets slow.
While having checkIfInMaintenanceMode() for a single client is required, we should also have a function which does a mass checking.
Maybe something like this:
List<Long> systemIdsMaintenanceMode(List<MinionServer> minions)

Could be implemented in MaintenanceManager.java

In the end, we check one-by-one, unfortunately (we don't have a method for checking whether a bunch of minions has maintenance windows in their calendars (currently it's implemented one by one)). But I agree that having the method suggested by you (systemIdsMaintenanceMode(mids)) should be there. Then we can optimize it somehow.

One more note about the logging: In order to prevent a flood of log messages, I think the following would make sense:

log a warning with the count of skipped minions
log a debug message (in case log level is >= DEBUG) with the minion ids (can explode)
What about mapping clients to maintenance schedules first and than just make this test for every maintenance schedule. This would limit the number of test a lot .
that was my initial thinking was making a bool status thing on the server...

I think this is incomplete. Just a variable without setter and getter does not make sense.
For now I would remove the changes for this class

We need both lists, the list which could execute the action and the one for the skipped systems as we want to log.
But it can also be achieved by creating the list of minions which can execute the action, and than use this:
minions.stream().filter(m -> !minionsInMaintMode.contains(m)).collect(toList())

for the logging
ms.getCalendarOpt().get() is a potential NullPointerException
Can we find a better name for this method?
As mc and me said: there is a high risk of NPEx (schedule can exist without calendar, so the risk is pretty high). You can fix this using the code I pasted in my latest comment.

I think we need to return !cc.isEmpty().
CalendarComponents are mtching maintenance windows. So when we find something we are in maintenance mode,
otherwise - when empty - we are not.
The stream -> collect is not necessary. You can feed action.computeMinions() directly to systemidsMaintenanceMode.
Collectors are not used anymore. Remove the import please.
Do you want to log names or ids? The message says ids, but you're logging names.
well names would make more sense in this case?  as it's what the people will see
Yes, they are more readable, but they are not unique. The readability is not that important here anyway (it's a log). So I think ids are a better option here.

This should check the id presence, not the whole entity.
